title: India rejects Pakistan’s airspace denial claims for Sri Lanka aid
byline: India has granted rapid clearance for Pakistan’s aid flight carrying relief material to cyclone-hit Sri Lanka, firmly rejecting “baseless and misleading” claims circulating in Pakistani media that New Delhi had denied permission to use its airspace.

title: Limited train services to operate today – Railway Department
byline: The Department of Railways has announced that main line train services will operate only up to Ambepussa today (02).

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Northern and Southern provinces, today (02), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Trump’s push for more AI data centers faces backlash from his own voters
byline: The residents came in camouflage hats and red shirts signaling unity, more than 300 of them packing into a rural Pennsylvania planning commission meeting to protest a proposed data center they feared would carve up their farmland and upend the quiet rhythms of their valley.

title: Telethon raises over MVR 11.4 million so far for Sri Lanka relief
byline: Over MVR 11.4 million has been donated to the nationwide telethon organised by Maldivian media outlets to assist Sri Lanka as the country grapples with severe flooding and devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: King Charles III expresses condolences to victims of recent Asian floods
byline: In a post on X (formerly Twitter), the British Royal Family has released a message from King Charles III expressing deep sorrow and solidarity with the people of South and Southeast Asia affected by the recent devastating storms and floods.

title: Athurugiriya entrance of Southern Expressway reopens
byline: The Athurugiriya entrance of the Southern Expressway, which was closed due to flooding caused by adverse weather, has now been reopened.

title: Kelani River water levels receding – Irrigation Department
byline: The Department of Irrigation announces that the water level of the Kelani River is currently receding.

title: Govt. introduces disaster relief cargo clearance procedure for overseas donors
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has introduced a simplified procedure for cargo clearance of essential goods donated by overseas donors for flood-affected communities, exempting all import taxes and levies.

title: India rejects reports of airspace denial to Pakistan for Sri Lanka aid flight
byline: India has granted rapid clearance for Pakistan’s aid flight carrying relief material to cyclone-hit Sri Lanka, firmly rejecting “baseless and misleading” claims circulating in Pakistani media that New Delhi had denied permission to use its airspace.

title: Police issue notice to relief teams assisting disaster victims
byline: Sri Lanka Police have stated that the presence of a large number of relief teams in disaster-hit areas is impeding ongoing road restoration efforts.

title: UAE launches urgent humanitarian aid for flood- and landslide-hit Sri Lanka
byline: The United Arab Emirates has initiated an urgent humanitarian response to assist communities affected by devastating floods and landslides across Sri Lanka.

title: Death toll in Indonesia floods passes 600
byline: The death toll in the floods which struck Indonesia last week has now climbed to more than 600, with rescue workers still battling to reach affected areas.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather climbs to 410
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reports that the number of deaths caused by the ongoing disaster situation affecting all 25 districts of the island has risen to 410.

title: Army conducts search for family missing after Kandapola landslide
byline: The Sri Lanka Army has launched a search operation to locate a family reported missing following a landslide in the Chandirigama area of Kandapola, caused by heavy rainfall in the area.

title: 21 foreigners stranded in Nuwara Eliya floods rescued by SLAF helicopter
byline: Twenty-one foreigners who were displaced due to the flood situation in the Nuwara Eliya area have been rescued, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Former Minister C.B. Rathnayake arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister C.B. Rathnayake has arrived today (02) at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Russia’s Putin extends condolences to cyclone ‘Ditwah’ victims in Sri Lanka
byline: The President of Russia, Vladimir Putin, has expressed his condolences to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake following the significant human casualties and extensive destruction caused by the recent floods and landslides in Sri Lanka.

title: No decision yet on revising school reopening date - Education Secretary
byline: Education Ministry Secretary Nalaka Kaluwewa has stated that no decision has been made regarding a revision of the school reopening date.

title: Samsung unveils first multi-folding phone as competition set to heat up
byline: Samsung Electronics unveiled on Tuesday its first multi-folding smartphone, in a bid to strengthen its position in a sector of the phone market where competition is expected to intensify.

title: Last rites of deceased pilot to be performed with full Air Force honours
byline: The last rites of the pilot who died in a helicopter crash in Lunuwila, Wennappuwa on Sunday (Nov. 30) will be performed with full Air Force honours on December 4.

title: Final rites of 31 individuals died following landslide in Udaththawa performed
byline: A total of 31 individuals belonging to 13 families died in a landslide reported in a village in Udaththawa, Kandy.

title: Woman who attempted to commit suicide by jumping into Malwathu Oya rescued
byline: A woman, who attempted to commit suicide by jumping into the Malwathu Oya in Anuradhapura has been rescued.

title: Former Minister C.B. Rathnayake arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister C. B. Rathnayake has been arrested today (02) by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Remaining A/L Exam subjects to be held in early January – Education Ministry
byline: The remaining subjects of the G.C.E. Advanced Level examination, which could not be held due to the adverse weather conditions in the country, will be conducted in early January 2026, the Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Nalaka Kaluwewe has announced.

title: Phone numbers introduced to report trees that pose risk to public
byline: The State Timber Corporation (STC), operating under the Ministry of Environment, has introduced several phone numbers for the general public to report trees that need to be felled due to road blockages or the potential risk of future tragedies arising from the prevailing disaster situation in the country.

title: Deadline to update information on ‘Aswesuma’ recipients list extended
byline: The Welfare Benefits Board of Sri Lanka has announced an extension for the period granted to recertify the information in list of eligible recipients under the ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit scheme.

title: Water level of Kelani River dropped to minor flood level
byline: The water level of the Kelani River has now dropped to a minor flood level, the Department of Irrigation has announced.

title: Steps taken to provide compensation to farmers promptly for crop damage
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board has taken steps to expedite the compensation process for crop damage owing to the severe adverse weather conditions and the resulting floods experienced across the country.

title: Chilaw Hospital OPD to reopen tomorrow
byline: The Ministry of Health has taken steps to reopen the Outpatient Department (OPD) of the Chilaw District General Hospital from tomorrow (03).

title: US Special Envoy for South Asia discusses ongoing rescue and relief efforts with President
byline: United States Ambassador to India and Special Envoy for South and Central Asia Sergio Gor has spoken to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake pertaining to the ongoing rescue and relief operation following Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Dawoodi Bohra Community donates Rs. 10 million for flood relief efforts
byline: The Sri Lanka Dawoodi Bohra community has made a financial donation of Rs. 10 million to assist the government’s relief programme for people affected by the adverse weather conditions in the country.

title: 275,000 children affected in Sri Lanka due to Cyclone Ditwah, UN estimates
byline: Over 275,000 children are estimated to have been affected due to the widespread floods and devastating landslides caused by Cyclone Ditwah in recent days, according to the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF).

title: Amount provided to restore landslide or flood-hit houses to habitable condition increased
byline: The government has decided to increase the amount provided to residents to restore each landslide or flood-hit houses to a habitable and hygienic condition from Rs. 10,000 to Rs. 25,000.

title: Sri Lanka sees record tourist arrivals in November 2025
byline: A total of 212,906 tourists have arrived in the country in the month of November, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: Several wildlife parks and guest houses to reopen tomorrow
byline: Several wildlife national parks and guest houses within the national parks that were closed due to adverse weather conditions will reopen tomorrow (03), the Ministry of Environment has announced.

title: Several services at Mahiyanganaya Hospital to resume tomorrow
byline: Cleaning operations have commenced at the Mahiyanganaya Base Hospital, which was affected by recent flooding, Dr. Anil Jasinghe, the Secretary to the Ministry of Health and Mass Media confirmed.

title: WHO provides emergency funds to scale up health response in Sri Lanka
byline: The World Health Organization has provided emergency funding of USD 175,000 to support essential health services in Sri Lanka as the country faces rapidly worsening conditions triggered by cyclonic storm “Ditwah”.

title: DMT fully restores driving license related services
byline: Driving license services at the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) have now been fully restored.

title: Over 4kg of ICE found during special operation in Beruwala
byline: Over 4 kilograms of Crystal Methamphetamine have been seized during a special search operation conducted on the Light House Island, Beruwala today (02).

title: Landslide evacuation warning issued to several areas in six districts extended
byline: The ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to multiple areas in six districts has been extended.

title: More than 1,300 dead in recent floods in South and South East Asia as rescue efforts intensify
byline: Emergency crews raced to reach survivors and recover more bodies Tuesday as the death toll from last week’s catastrophic floods and landslides surged past 1,300 in Indonesia, Sri Lanka and Thailand, with more than 800 people missing.

title: Public urged to use water sparingly
byline: The general public has been urged to use water sparingly, as some water supply systems in Kandy, Puttalam, Kurunegala and several areas are not operating at full capacity, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced.

title: Death toll due to Cyclone Ditwah increases to 465
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days has climbed to 465, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka continues to receive extensive international humanitarian support
byline: Sri Lanka continues to receive extensive international humanitarian support in response to the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah, which has resulted in significant loss of life, widespread destruction and the displacement of hundreds of thousands of people across the country.

title: Office train operations disrupted due to lack of power sets in Colombo
byline: The Sri Lanka Railways Station Masters’ Association states that office train operations have been significantly disrupted due to the inability to bring 39 train power sets to Colombo for service as a result of recent landslides and flooding in the country.

title: Northeast monsoon conditions gradually establishing; Showers expected to increase
byline: The Northeast monsoon condition is expected to gradually establish over the island during the next few days, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Ex-Minister C.B. Rathnayake remanded
byline: Former Minister CB Rathnayake, who was arrested earlier today by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, has been remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: UAE relief mission lands in Sri Lanka with essential supplies
byline: A humanitarian relief shipment from the United Arab Emirates (UAE) arrived in Sri Lanka today (02) to support communities severely affected by the recent disaster.
